chat.msg: Welcome!
ok so tell me where you are right now
For the sake of time I'm gonna assume you're near the tiger
Okay, I am standing near the tiger. What path should I take now?
oh perfect ok
Can you please tell me which direction I should go to continue towards the treasure?
go past the tiger and cross the river, you'll find a stick there
Alright, I crossed the river and found the stick. What should I do next? Which direction should I go?
go towards the parrot
and now turn to your left and you will need to cross the river again towards the frog
Okay, turning left and crossing the river towards the frog. What should I do next?
do you see the alligator?
go past the alligator and head towards the giraffe
I am going past the alligator and heading towards the giraffe. What should I do next?
take a slight turn left and go towards the snake
Got it. I have taken a slight left turn and reached the snake. What do I do next?
the treasure is in front of it
Great, I found the treasure! Thank you for your guidance.

chat.msg: Welcome!
you're standing near a dog walk straight till you reach a path and turn left
Great! I see the wooden path to my left. Should I head north or south on the path?
just take a slight turn and walk toward the branch
use it as a bridge to go towards the dog at the picnic
Got it! I'm walking across the wooden branch over to the other side of the river. I see the dog you mentioned sitting on the picnic carpet. Should I head north or south from here?
walk past the picnic and use the branch close to it as a bridge to cross the river again
turn around on the bush and go past the couple on a bycicle

Alright! I'm crossing the branch near the picnic towards the other side of the river. Now, I'm walking past the couple on the bicycle. 

Should I continue straight, or is there any other direction I should take from here?
turn left once you finish crossing the bridge
Understood! I'm taking a left turn after crossing the bridge. Is there anything particular I should look for or any object I should find from this point?
go past the old couple reading the newspaper
Alright! I'm walking past the old couple reading the newspaper. What should be my next step?
take a slight turn left and you'll find a deer

Great, now I'm taking a slight turn to my left. I see a brown deer in front of me. 

Am I done with the navigation?
yes you did it

chat.msg: Welcome!
go towards the dog and turn left once you reach him
I'm currently at a tent located at the north of the map. Moving south, I see a dog sitting on the left side of a fire. Should I head towards the dog first then turn left?
yes
Okay, I've reached the dog, and I'm turning left. Should I continue moving straight after turning left or is there a different direction I should take?
keep walking straight and go around the fire
I've gone around the fire and kept walking straight, now I see a red mushroom on the right side of the fire and a blue car on the south of the mushroom. What should I do next?
do you see a telescope?
Yes, I see it! It's a blue telescope located south of the blue car. What should I do next?
go towards it
I'm heading towards the blue telescope. Should I keep going straight or turn somewhere?
go past the telescope and turn right
Alright, I've passed the telescope and turned right. What do I see now?
you'll see a cavin
do you see the cabin?
I'm sorry, I'm unable to see any cabin. Are there any other landmarks that could help me locate the cabin?
do you see rocks?
Yes, I can see rocks! They're located to the west of the blue telescope. Should I head towards the rocks?
yes go towards the rocks and the cabin is in the middle
Alright, I'm moving towards the rocks. And now, I can see a wooden house in the middle of the rocks. Is that the cabin you were referring to?
yes
Great! I've made it to the wooden house. Thank you for guiding me through the map. Is there anything else that you need my help with, or is our task now finished?

general_survey.answer: I think it's cool that their brain can do that
general_survey.question: What do you think when others mix languages in conversation? Please explain:

general_survey.answer: Although my native language is spanish, I grew up in the USA and therefore I feel more confident reading, writing and speaking in English.
general_survey.question: Any final comments about your language background?
